Open the Museum Cat. folder to get the list of files to download
to help you navigate which group of plates to download:
listplates1.jpg
listplates2.jpg
SHcatTN.zip = Thumbnail version of ALL plates

buycatalog.doc = all the contact info needed to acquire this
catalog...here is my sales pitch...I think this book is really
inexpensive for $35.85 because the exhibit managed to bring together
items from all over Japan...the photos are awesome and the scrolls all
have accompanying typed kanji beneath it so you can actually read what
the letters say (if you know Japanese)

I left out 20 pages of Japanese text (contains photos we've seen
before on the Miburo Yahoo Groups)

In fact if any of you can't download huge files just go to see some of
the photos @ Mibur Yahoo Groups under the "files" section
